com.navis.framework.persistence.scope

Class ScopedQueryUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.navis.framework.persistence.scope.ScopedQueryUtils

  • public class ScopedQueryUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has some query utilities for generic scoped queries and also for extensions.
    Author:
    Gisella Saavedra, Aug 6, 2009

    • Method Detail

      • getEntityQueryForBroadestAllowedScope

        public static DomainQuery getEntityQueryForBroadestAllowedScope(@NotNull
                                                                UserContext inUserContext,
                                                                java.lang.String inEntityName,
                                                                MetafieldId inScopeLevelFieldId,
                                                                MetafieldId inScopeGkeyFieldId)
        Builds a query for the user's context broadest scope subtree. Note that Nodes above broadest scope are not retrieved.

        One use of this is for CRUD operations (not for LIST in the case of Extensions).

        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user's context
        inEntityName - name of entity to be scoped
        inScopeLevelFieldId - metafield Id of SCOPE_LEVEL field
        inScopeGkeyFieldId - metafield Id of SCOPE_GKEY field
        Returns:
        a query of scoped entity objects for a CRUD operation (the LIST operation might not apply)

      • getEntityQueryForBroadestViewableScope

        public static DomainQuery getEntityQueryForBroadestViewableScope(@NotNull
                                                                 UserContext inUserContext,
                                                                 java.lang.String inEntityName,
                                                                 MetafieldId inScopeLevelFieldId,
                                                                 MetafieldId inScopeGkeyFieldId)
        Builds a query for the user's context broadest scope subtree in addition to the parent hierarchy above the broadest scope.

        One use of this is for for LISTing (viewing) in the case of Extensions).

        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user's context
        inEntityName - name of entity to be scoped
        inScopeLevelFieldId - metafield Id of SCOPE_LEVEL field
        inScopeGkeyFieldId - metafield Id of SCOPE_GKEY field
        Returns:
        a query of scoped entity objects for a LIST operation (special cases)

      • getEntityQueryForScope

        public static DomainQuery getEntityQueryForScope(@NotNull
                                                 ScopeCoordinates inScopeCoordinates,
                                                 java.lang.String inEntityName,
                                                 MetafieldId inScopeLevelFieldId,
                                                 MetafieldId inScopeGkeyFieldId)
        Builds a query for the scope subtree corresponding to the scope coordinates passed.
        Parameters:
        inScopeCoordinates - scope coordinates for root of subtree
        inEntityName - name of entity to be scoped
        inScopeLevelFieldId - metafield Id of SCOPE_LEVEL field
        inScopeGkeyFieldId - metafield Id of SCOPE_GKEY field
        Returns:
        a query of scoped entity objects for the scope subtree given

      • getScopedChildrenLovKeysQuery

        @Nullable
public static DomainQuery getScopedChildrenLovKeysQuery(UserContext inUserContext,
                                                                   int inScopeLevel)
        Creates a query for the scope coordinates values available for a given scope level. For this method to be successfully called, the caller needs to have already started a transaction.
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user context
        inScopeLevel - scope level (GLOBAL = 1...)
        Returns:
        query

      • getScopeCoordsName

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String getScopeCoordsName(@NotNull
                                                             ScopeCoordinates inCoords)
        Finds the string address representation of the given scope coordinates. For this method to be successfully called, the caller needs to have already started a transaction.
        Parameters:
        inCoords - scope coordinates of an object
        Returns:
        address of scope coordinates

      • getScopeLevelName

        public static java.lang.Object getScopeLevelName(@NotNull
                                                 ScopeCoordinates inCoords)
        Finds the Scope level (IScopeEnum) as an object corresponding to the given scope coordinates. For this method to be successfully called, the caller needs to have already started a transaction.
        Parameters:
        inCoords - scope coordinates
        Returns:
        IScopeEnum as object

      • getScopeLevelName

        public static java.lang.Object getScopeLevelName(@NotNull
                                                 java.lang.Long inScopeLevel)
        Finds the Scope level (IScopeEnum) as an object corresponding to the given scope coordinates. For this method to be successfully called, the caller needs to have already started a transaction.
        Parameters:
        inScopeLevel - scope level
        Returns:
        IScopeEnum as object

      • getOperatedOnExtensionQueryForBroadestScope

        @Deprecated
public static DomainQuery getOperatedOnExtensionQueryForBroadestScope(@NotNull
                                                                                   UserContext inUserContext)
        Deprecated. 
        Builds a query for the Extension table given the fact that only two scopes are used, GLOBAL and LEVEL_1. The query retrieves the extensions that the user can operate on based on the user's broadest scope. A generic query would be given by getEntityQueryForBroadestViewableScope(), but this query is simpler.

        One use of this is for for LISTing (viewing) in the case of Extensions).

        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user's context
        Returns:
        a query of scoped entity objects for a LIST operation (special cases)

      • getEntityPredicateForEffectiveScope

        public static PredicateIntf getEntityPredicateForEffectiveScope(ScopeCoordinates inScopeCoordinates,
                                                                MetafieldId inScopeLevelFieldId,
                                                                MetafieldId inScopeGkeyFieldId)
        Creates an OR predicate for entity elements based on the scope fields. It will add the nodes for the most specific level (login scope) up the parent hierarchy.

        This query is to be used to find the effective scoped entity element that applies to a user's.

        Parameters:
        inScopeCoordinates - scope coordinates for walking the tree. This customarily would be the login scope.
        inScopeLevelFieldId - metafield Id of SCOPE_LEVEL field
        inScopeGkeyFieldId - metafield Id of SCOPE_GKEY field
        Returns:
        predicate query for scoped hierarchy (parent chain)

      • getScopedQueryExtensionsForType

        @Deprecated
public static DomainQuery getScopedQueryExtensionsForType(UserContext inUserContext,
                                                                       java.lang.String inExtensionType)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a query that will search for extensions of a given type within the user's scope. Note that GLOBAL extensions are usable to everybody, while extensions at LEVEL_1 will have to match the scope inheritance tree of the user.
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user's context
        inExtensionType - extension type
        Returns:
        query

      • getScopedQueryExtensionsForScopedTrigger

        public static DomainQuery getScopedQueryExtensionsForScopedTrigger(int inScopeLevel,
                                                                   java.io.Serializable inScopeGkey,
                                                                   @NotNull
                                                                   java.lang.String inExtensionType)
        Creates a query that will search for enabled extensions of a given type within the given scope. Note that GLOBAL extensions are usable to everybody, while extensions at LEVEL_n will have to match the scope inheritance tree of the user.
        Parameters:
        inScopeLevel - trigger scope level
        inScopeGkey - trigger scope level gkey
        inExtensionType - extension type
        Returns:
        query

      • getScopedTriggersForEntity

        public static DomainQuery getScopedTriggersForEntity(ScopeCoordinates inScopeCoordinates,
                                                     java.lang.String inEntityname)
        Creates an extension trigger query based on the login coordinates of the user where the enabled triggers are retrieved in descending order (closer to user's login scope is on top).
        Parameters:
        inScopeCoordinates - ScopeCoordinates of User, login coordinates expected
        inEntityname - entity name
        Returns:
        query

      • getEffectiveScopedExtension

        public static DomainQuery getEffectiveScopedExtension(@NotNull
                                                      UserContext inUserContext,
                                                      @Nullable
                                                      java.lang.String inExtensionType,
                                                      @NotNull
                                                      java.lang.String inExtensionName)
        Builds a DomainQuery with the given name for the given user log-in scope. The extension scope has to be up the scope hierarchy of the user. Note that passing the extension type is optional. The uniqueness of the extension is given by the scope and the name. By passing the type, we are ensuring that the named extension is of the right type.
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user context whose scope coordinates will be used
        inExtensionType - extension type (optional)
        inExtensionName - extension name
        Returns:
        the code extension object; null if object not found.

      • getEffectiveScopedWebResource

        public static DomainQuery getEffectiveScopedWebResource(@NotNull
                                                        UserContext inUserContext,
                                                        @Nullable
                                                        WebResourceTypeEnum inWebResourceType,
                                                        @NotNull
                                                        java.lang.String inWebResourceName)
        Builds a DomainQuery with the given name for the given user log-in scope. The web resource scope has to be up the scope hierarchy of the user. Note that passing the extension type is optional. The uniqueness of the web resource is given by the scope and the name. By passing the type, we are ensuring that the named web resource is of the right type.
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user context whose scope coordinates will be used
        inWebResourceType - extension type (optional)
        inWebResourceName - extension name
        Returns:
        the code extension object; null if object not found.

      • getScopeName

        public static java.lang.String getScopeName(int inScopeLevel,
                                            java.io.Serializable inScopeKey)
        Decloned from 5 different places in framework entities but most likely it's quite inefficient when called in a loop.
        Parameters:
        inScopeLevel - level
        inScopeKey - key
        Returns:
        user friendly name representing the scope gkey
